alert.note: Alert for Summit (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 2:24AM EST until February 18 at 3:16PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Stark and Summit. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 216 AM EST, automated gauges report flooding across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Minor to moderate flooding is occurring across the Nimishillen Creek basin, including the West, Central, and East Branches and Zimber Ditch. Flooding was also being reported from the Sandy Creek near Waynesburg. Flooding is expected to continue through the morning hours as waters continue to recede across the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Akron, Canton, Cuyahoga Falls, Massillon, Barberton, Green, Alliance, Tallmadge, North Canton, Louisville, Mogadore, Minerva, Hartville, Brewster, Navarre, Waynesburg, East Sparta, Wilmot, Stow and New Franklin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
